info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 1:26PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 200 PM MDT... At 126 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms about 7 miles northwest of Springer, moving southeast at 5 to 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springer, Cimarron, Maxwell, Philmont Scout Ranch, Rayado and Miami. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 408 and 433. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 304 and 320. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
